comment: Device Settings Sound Resource Type adapted to DTDL from smartdatamodels.org. Source: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/smart-data-models/dataModel.OCF/master/settings-sound/schema.json
description: Smart Data Models Program adaptation of the original IoTData data Models. Gets current device sound settings.

contents.name: alternateName
contents.comment: An alternative name for this item

contents.name: areaServed
contents.comment: The geographic area where a service or offered item is provided

contents.name: auto-volume
contents.comment: Automatically equalizes the volume level when switching to antother channel.

contents.name: dataProvider
contents.comment: A sequence of characters identifying the provider of the harmonised data entity

contents.name: dateCreated
contents.comment: Entity creation timestamp. This will usually be allocated by the storage platform

contents.name: dateModified
contents.comment: Timestamp of the last modification of the entity. This will usually be allocated by the storage platform

contents.name: sound-mode
contents.comment: Device Settings Sound - Sound Mode. Client can change sound-mode using supported-sound-modes property.

contents.name: source
contents.comment: A sequence of characters giving the original source of the entity data as a URL. Recommended to be the fully qualified domain name of the source provider, or the URL to the source object

contents.name: speaker
contents.comment: Device Settings Sound - Speaker. Client can change speaker using supported-speakers property.

contents.name: if
contents.comment: No description is available in the original

contents.name: owner
contents.comment: A List containing a JSON encoded sequence of characters referencing the unique Ids of the owner(s)

contents.name: rt
contents.comment: The Resource Type of Device Settings for sound

contents.name: supported-sound-modes
contents.comment: The array of possible sound modes the device supports. This property should be added if sound-mode is supported.

contents.name: supported-speakers
contents.comment: The array of possible speakers the device supports. This property should be added if speaker is supported.
